result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy L. Degner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances, unless prescribed and to be only taken as prescribed;

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy L. Degner

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:36p.m.
Clerk Micki.     
State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in person, in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Heather Roehr.
Date and time set for waiver preliminary hearing/plea/sentencing hearing.

Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
AMEND COUNT 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense >> Delete Repeater enhancer.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
AMENDED COUNT 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs, Second and Subsequent Offense >> GUILTY. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances, unless prescribed and to be only taken as prescribed; AODA and f/u; CC; and DNA on file, pay surcharge. 3 days jail credit.  Court allows defense counsel 10 days to file stipulation for jail credit, if jail credit is different than 3 days. 

Adj: 2:52p.m.
Re: Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum
Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person w/Attorney Heather Roehr
DATES: to remain on calendar

Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Micki. 
Case called: 2:17p.m.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ via Zoom, with Attorney Greg Venturini.

COURT quashes warrant. 
Date and time set for initial appearance/warrant quash. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived.

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to Attic Correctional Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Dates:
PTC: 06/23/2022 at 9:00a.m.
PH: 07/18/2022 at 2:30p.m.
JPTC: 08/30/2022 at 2:30p.m.

Adj: 2:20p.m.
$30.00 warrant fee. Brought to jail by Wausau PD
